Academic Research

“Understanding Child Behavioral Health in COVID Times: Influential Factors in Children Aged 6-11” Fall 2023

  • Applied a multinomial logistic regression to entropy-balanced data from a pre-pandemic and post-pandemic year of the National Survey of Children’s Health to determine if experience with the COVID-19 pandemic caused an increase in developmental delays, learning disabilities, and behavioral/conduct problems in children 6-11 years old

“Machine Learning to Interpret Cardiotocograms (CTGs)” Spring 2023

  • Used penalized logistic regression, k-nearest neighbor’s (KNN), boosting (XGBoost), and support vector machine (SVM) algorithms to test models that predicted whether a fetus was at risk for hypoxia based on CTG data

  • Achieved a macro f1 score of 0.924 for a three-class outcome variabl

“Increasing Staff Retention in the Disability Services Sector” Fall 2020

  • Identified public health problems at a human services organization and applied evidence-based research to make recommendations to reduce burnout and increase staff retention

“American Conceptions of Nutritional Health: A Cross-Cultural Comparison of Food-Based Dietary Guidelines” Spring 2020

  • Conducted a content analysis focusing on the effects of culture on nutrition recommendations

  • Awarded Thesis with Distinction
